contacts.name: Washington State University Veterinary Teaching Hospital
contacts.notes: The most comprehensive wildlife medical facility in the region. Call ahead to coordinate arrival, especially for large or dangerous animals.

contacts.name: WDFW Enforcement Dispatch (After Hours/Emergency)
contacts.notes: For situations requiring a wildlife officer, such as public safety threats from wildlife, poaching, or severely injured large game. For immediate, life-threatening emergencies, call 911.

contacts.name: Washington State Patrol
contacts.notes: Primary contact for immediate public safety threats involving animals on major highways (e.g., deer, elk, cattle causing a traffic hazard).

contacts.name: Central Washington Wildlife Hospital
contacts.notes: Located near Ellensburg. Does not handle large mammals (deer, bears), raptors, or bats. Call before bringing an animal.

contacts.name: Blue Mountain Wildlife
contacts.notes: Located in Pendleton, OR, but serves SE Washington. Specializes in birds. Top resource for injured raptors.

contacts.name: Spokane County Regional Animal Protection Service (SCRAPS)
contacts.notes: Primary service for stray, loose, or aggressive domestic animals in Spokane County. Not equipped for wildlife.

contacts.name: Pet Emergency Clinic & Referral Center (Spokane)
contacts.notes: Primarily for domestic pets. Can provide emergency stabilization for small wildlife before transfer to a licensed rehabilitator. Call ahead to confirm capability.

contacts.name: WDFW Eastern Region (Region 1) Office
contacts.notes: Business hours only. For general questions, non-emergency wildlife conflict advice. Does not provide medical services.

contacts.name: WDFW North Central Region (Region 2) Office
contacts.notes: Business hours only. For general questions, non-emergency wildlife conflict advice. Does not provide medical services.

contacts.name: Wenatchee Valley Humane Society
contacts.notes: Handles animal control for several cities in the area. May provide limited assistance or referrals for small wildlife. Call first.

contacts.name: Washington State Department of Health Emergency Line
contacts.notes: 24/7 emergency disease reporting and consultation line for potential human or pet exposure to rabies and other reportable diseases. This is not a rescue or dispatch service.

contacts.name: Okanogan County Sheriff's Office
contacts.notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues (dogs at large, neglect, etc.).

contacts.name: Stevens County Sheriff's Office
contacts.notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues.

contacts.name: Pend Oreille County Sheriff's Office
contacts.notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues.
